lexUnit.name: hang.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to allow (one's head) to fall, droop

sentence.text: His body tilted to horizontal , legs and arms hanging like a spider from a strand .
He stood swaying , almost on the point of collapse , his arms hanging limply by his sides , the revolver dangling from his right hand .
Zeno stood in front of the priest , arms hanging down , his face sallow and lean with rage .
Zimm 's arms hung loosely by his sides , the fingers alternately stretching and relaxing .
When I asked him for his reaction , he sat hunched behind a table in his little palace , his head hanging down , his half-moon spectacles on the end of his nose .
The neck was stretched out in front so the head hung down low , almost as low as the tiny hooves .
Still in his underclothes , Ebenezer lay sprawled across the bed , his head hanging down over the side , his one hand clawing at his throat .
He went to the bathroom , hung his head over the toilet bowl .
He pouted , and hung his head .
Once more she hung her head not sure how to reply .
He was hanging his head over the edge of the bed and wondering what to do next when a spring burst in the mattress .
Seated on top of it was a fluffy white dog , its red tongue grotesquely hanging out , its head lolling to the side .
Davide hung his head in mourning .
She refused to be cowardly and hang her head .
Others hung their heads in meek submission .
` His arm was hanging limply and I feared he might have lost it altogether .
